vocabulary.english: to be able to say something (OF(O), OF(a))
to be able to get something (OF(O), OF(a))

contents.markdown: The previous lesson covered AF _ma_- verbs. This one covers OF _ma_- verbs.
They may have the nuance OF(a), which means “to be able” to do something, they may have the nuance of doing something unintentionally, and they may have neither of these nuances depending on context.
Some are used for sensing something.

In the vocabulary list, you may be wondering why all definitions show the OF(a) variant, but only two verbs have “to be able” in the written definition. That is because those two verbs are primarily used as OF(a), and when OF(a) is not needed, a different verb type is used. For example, _makita_ may mean “to be able to see something” or just “to see something”. _Masabi_, on the other hand, primarily means “to be able to say something”, and an -_in_ verb is used for “to say something”.

item.english: I will see Maria (sensing), or I will be able to see Maria (to be able).
The man is able to get the mango (to be able).

item.tagalog: Naisip ni David ang anak niya.
item.english: David thought about his child (sensing), or David happened to think about his child (unintentional).

contents.markdown: These are OF(O) verbs, so as a reminder:

exampleSentences.tagalog: Sino ang nakita ni Analyn sa tindahan nung alas siyete ng umaga?
exampleSentences.english: Who did Analyn see at the store at 7am?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Naaalala ko ang pusa sa bahay ng aso ni Diego.
exampleSentences.english: I remember the cat in Diego's dog's house.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Maiisip ba niya ang pangalan ng babae?
exampleSentences.english: Will he be able to think of the woman's name?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Nasabi ba ni Mrs. Cruz ang petsa kahapon?
exampleSentences.english: Was Mrs. Cruz able to tell you the date yesterday?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Nakukuha nina Maria at David ang lechon sa kuwartong yun.
exampleSentences.english: Maria and David are able to get the grilled pig out of that room.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Makikita po ninyo ang maraming puno sa Seattle sa Huwebes.
exampleSentences.english: You (pl.) will be able to see the many trees in Seattle on Thursday.
We remembered the teacher who died..

exampleSentences.tagalog: Ano ang naiisip ni Sir Bautista sa gabi?
exampleSentences.english: What does Mr. Bautista think of at night?
It is good the truth gets told unintentionally.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Hindi nila makukuha ang mabilis na bata para sa iyo.
exampleSentences.english: They will not be able to get the fast kid for you.
